page.title: 14POPULATION AND PLACE NAMES
page.content: Worral's directory of 1874 described Bagillt as a "large thriving village in the township of Bagillt Fawr and Bagillt Fechan in the parish and union of Holywell and situated about 2 and a half miles from the town of Holywell and the same distance from Flint...." By the late 19 century the population was nearly 3000. The name of Bagillt has changed over the years.In 1086 it was Bachelie.It became Bacheleia in the 13 century, Bagythel in 1300,Backelegh in 1325, Bakkeleigh in 1360,Bakeley in 1536, Bagild in 1539 and Bagylht in 1695. We are not sure how Bagillt got its name.Research suggests it could have been named after a rich man who owned the land.Another explanation is that it means "a clearing in a forest where the wild boar is found".Nobody knows for sure .
